snippet: The kidnapping of more than 20 Syrians in Lebanon, in revenge for a rebel abduction in Damascus, spread fear in Beirut that such kidnappings were just the beginning.
abstract: Abduction of more than 30 Syrians inside Lebanese territory, in revenge for a rebel abduction in Damscus, spreads fear in Beirut that the kidnappings are just the beginning; members of a powerful Lebanese Shiite family threaten to cause havoc in the streets and conduct an extended kidnapping and killing spree until their family member, taken hostage by Syrian rebels, is set free.

byline.original: By DALAL MAWAD and DAMIEN CAVE
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad from Antakya, Turkey; C. J. Chivers from Aleppo, Syria; Alan Cowell from London; and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: The kidnapping of more than 20 Syrians in Lebanon, in revenge for a rebel abduction in Damascus, spread fear in Beirut that such kidnappings were just the beginning.

headline.seo: Syria Conflict Spills Into Lebanon With Rash of Kidnappings
headline.main: Syrian Conflict Crosses Border Into Lebanon in Abductions
headline.print_headline: Syrian Conflict Crosses Border Into Lebanon In Abductions
